title: Highlight Container
reference-overview: The Highlight Container is used to highlight or draw attention to something that might be important to the user - a small bit of data, a couple lines of text or a valuable link.
reference-usage: This message container should be used when you want to highlight some valuable piece of data/information to the user.
reference-details:
This is a simple container with square corners and a light blue (#E8F0F7) background.

The container can support any type of content inside of it, although the intent is to keep the data/information very brief.

The containers can fit inside of any grid layout.
reference-mobile: The container itself is responsive, and it will take up 100% of the available space (or the containing element).
reference-technical: Make note to use an h4 for the bold text, it will set up the content to look like it does in the example.
